BULLETIN NO.139 
LIFE-SAVING RULES 
07/10/2021 
 
BACKGROUND 
To help mitigate the risk of serious incidents happening and to protect staff from work-related fatalities, 
it is good practice to implement a standard set of rules that are easy to understand and to follow. These 
are commonly known as Life-Saving Rules. A study by the International Association of Oil & Gas 
Producers (IOGP) suggests that from 2008 to 2017, 376 lives could have been saved via the 
implementation and adherence to this set of 9 rules (Source: IOGP report 459; August 2018). 
SUMMARY 
JIG recommends that facilities operating to the JIG Standards implement a set of Life-Saving Rules. In 
the absence of an internally defined set of Life-Saving Rules and where possible, JIG recommends 
adoption of the IOGP Life-saving rules, according to which 80% of global incidents are related to the 
Industry Life-Saving Rules risk area, while 20% of fatalities since 2014 are related to the Line of Fire rule 
included in the IOGP Life-Saving Rules. 
Many companies in the Oil & Gas Industry, including several JIG members, have transitioned to the IOGP 
Life-Saving Rules and many contractors and suppliers are strongly supportive of the industry wide 
standardization of Life-Saving Rules. The IOGP Life-Saving Rules are standardized and simple rules "to 
provide workers in the industry with the actions they can

ngly supportive of the industry wide 
standardization of Life-Saving Rules. The IOGP Life-Saving Rules are standardized and simple rules "to 
provide workers in the industry with the actions they can take to protect themselves and their colleagues 
from fatalities" (IOGP 2021). 
Rather than prescriptive 'dos and don'ts', the IOGP Life-Saving Rules are written as intent-based 
'I statements' which require everyone to engage personally and demonstrate how they will comply. The 
language also makes it clear how everyone must work together with a shared responsibility for Personal 
Safety and help each other to comply. The rules require people to engage more deeply with their 
colleagues, understanding the dynamics of the task - holding quality and ongoing conversations about 
how the rules apply to their work. 
These rules help to reduce the need for re-training of workers based on which facility or location they 
work at, and transfer learning more easily between industry partners. All of which means there is a higher 
likelihood that the rules will help save lives. 
The use of IOGP rules and their associated supporting material is free of charge and available in multiple 
languages.
